page.title: 02TATTON HALL
page.content: {TATTON HALL}BELONGED TO THE EGERTON FAMILY FROM 1598 TO 1958 WHEN, ON THE DEATH OF THE 4TH AND LAST LORD EGERTON,IT WENT TO THE{NATIONAL TRUST. IT IS ADMINISTERED BY{CHESHIRE COUNTY {COUNCIL}AND ATTRACTS MANY VISITORS TO {MANSION, GARDENS,PARK AND EVENTS. ONLY THE ROCOCO DINING ROOM REMAINS FROM AN EARLIER HOUSE.IT IS ELEGANTLY SET FOR A GRAND DINNER FOR 12. THE REST OF THE HOUSE IS{NEO-CLASSICAL BUILT BY SAMUEL WYATT AND NEPHEW LEWIS BETWEEN 179O AND 18I3, THE ORIGINAL GILLOW FURNISHINGS CAN BE SEEN THROUGHOUT THE HOUSE AND ARE AT THEIR BEST IN THE{REGENCY {BEDROOMS.}THE LIBRARY HOUSES ONE OF THE BEST NATIONAL TRUST COLLECTIONS. THOUGH GRAND AND SPACIOUS THE HOUSE HAS A LIVED IN FAMILY ATMOSPHERE PARTLY CREATED BY FRESH FLOWER ARRANGEMENTS FROM THE GARDENS.
